bill_title: revise the list of practices not considered to be veterinary medicine.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the list of practices not considered to be veterinary medicine. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-12-2 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-2. The following persons shall not be considered to be engaging A person is not engaged in the practice of veterinary medicine in this state , if the person is : (1) Those who administer to Administering livestock , and the title of which the livestock rests in himself the person , or in his the person's regular employer, or free service in any case; (2) Those who conduct Conducting experimentation in scientific research in the development of methods, technics , or treatment , directly or indirectly applicable to the problems of medicine and who in connection therewith uses animals for scientific research ; (3) Services to Servicing poultry in its entirety ; (4) Regular students A student in a legally chartered and recognized college of veterinary medicine, while in the performance of studies and acts assigned by their instructors the student's instructor ; (5) Those who are licensed Licensed in another state of the United States when if engaged in this state in consultation with veterinarians legally practicing herein in South Dakota , providing such consultation does not exceed thirty days in any one year; (6) Those who are senior students A senior student in an approved school of veterinary medicine and who shall obtain has obtained from the board of veterinary medical examiners an undergraduate permit to practice in the office and under the direct supervision of any veterinarian practicing within this state; (7) Those who are employees An employee of the State of South Dakota or the United States of America while in the performance of their employee's duties as such employee ; (8) Those selling Selling drugs, medicines, household remedies , or appliances at wholesale or retail and advising as to the use and purpose of such drugs, medicines, household remedies , or appliances ; or (9) Spaying, castrating, or dehorning of cattle, sheep, horses, or swine .
